runs.comm: nips off the seam and clips the thigh-pad. Good pace and carry first up
outside off stump and there for the cut, but more good seam movement cramps Vincent for room
perfect line and length, jags back into the right-hander again, and deflected into the covers
good leave, just outside off stump once again, and Kamran takes comfortably
hustled into the leg-side, another ball that started outside off and jagged off the seam. Excellent bowling
no room for manoeuvre whatsoever. Vincent is drawn forward in a textbook defence, and that's the end of the first over
pitches outside leg but McCullum is slightly baffled by that one and gets a slight leading edge to cover
straight across the right-hander. Brilliant line, pitching on middle and leg and zipping past the edge
beaten again. Lovely rhythm from Pakistan's openers
driven uppishly, and gully collects a thick edge. New Zealand's openers are starting to feel the pinch
width, but that one whistles through with extra bounce, and Vincent misses out again
on the spot again, Vincent deflects into the off side with an open face, and deep point tidies up
brilliant bowling from Asif, tempting an indiscretion with his drip-drip line and length. Vincent has no option but to tip and run into the covers
pushed back onto the stumps, slightly shorter in length but the perfect line again
drawn forward and defended into the covers again. Who says Twenty20 isn't a bowler's game. It is if you're good enough
swished across the line, the first sign of aggression/desperation. In fairness it was a calculated risk, Asif has been nipping from off to leg, so Vincent went with the movement
the shackles are broken at last. Using the pace of the bowler, and beat midwicket with superb timing
width on the off side this time from Asif, and McCullum climbs into it with such a thirst for runs that one hand comes off the bat. But backward is beaten all the same
no mercy from Tanvir, back on the spot straight away
deflected into the covers
nothing doing with that delivery, pitching on middle and angling across. So it is pushed up to mid-off for another single
excellent running brings two to a steer to third man. Vincent had to scamper but the throw was poor
thumped! A fraction too short from Tanvir and he is deposited into the brewery for his sins! That's a big hit, clears the stand by a distance
same shot, similar result! Tanvir dragged it down a little too much and Vincent was into position in a trice. The ball plops a foot inside the rope
left alone outside off stump. Quite a contrast to the last two swipes
dragged forward by yet another beautiful length delivery. Defended into the covers
oops, overthrows from a direct hit. Midwicket had a dart, just to put the non-striker back in his box. But the ball ricocheted away for the exact opposite effect!
come forward or hang back? McCullum can't decide. And a dot ball is the upshot
pushed into the gap this time, but still no freedom for the batsmen
a rare loose delivery, a full toss. And Vincent is so surprised he almost runs himself out. The shy from mid-off hit the stumps, but the batsman was home
brilliant work from Afridi on the midwicket boundary, who stretches to claw a certain four back in from the ropes. Just a little too short from Tanvir
oops, he over-steps. A free hit coming up ...
yorker length, brilliant ball for a Test match. But Taufel calls wide as it snuck down the leg-side. The free hit still applies
that was a teasing response. A slow hand-grenade of a delivery, and he gets away with it
full-length, an attempted clip to midwicket, but doesn't connect properly
pushed into the covers, and more overthrows as Younis is unsighted by the umpire as the shy comes in, and fumbles Misbah's shy from the covers
slower ball, Vincent tried to welly it, but didn't connect properly
clipped to square leg, and the rain is getting heavy now
and he starts with a leg-side anomaly. The ball must be difficult to grip in these conditions
dabbed into the covers
skid and bounce off a good length, and Vincent deflects to third man
on middle, veering towards leg, McCullum controlling the bounce by getting over it and nudging off the pads very fine
on off this time, driven back forward with no more than a push
nibbled to gully  and Simon Taufel calls for the third umpire to rule on a return to the keeper. He didn't need long - he was well in
eased with the wrists into the off-side
a wide delivery down off, cut away through point
slower, more loop, and can't connect with a back-cut flap
tighter and dealt with
swept from off through midwicket and a misfield at the bowler's end allows the second and the fifty
terrific return catch - Vincent driving hard on the up and Fawad is quick to get his hands to the ball
off the mark immediately with a sweep to midwicket, and he's stolen the strike, too
full delivery on off, Styris eases the ball to mid-on
outside off, makes room to rock back and cut firmly to point for a comfortable single
played off the legs square for an easy single again
drags it a touch short and with width enough outside off for Styris to create some room to cut forcefully off the back foot, eluding the dives of some fielders
worked behind point now for an easy single
veering down leg, worked to the 45 where the ball's eventually met by the man running up from deep backward square leg
outside off, width, cut square out to deep point but there's some tidy work just inside the boundary
short and McCullum is quick-as-a-flash onto a pull through midwicket, but the man patrolling deep midwicket is on to it
worked off the legs for an easy single this time
a drive out to cover
only just slightly short but Styris does not miss out - freeing his shoulders to pull strongly in front of square
worked out to cover and that's the halfway mark
played off the back foot into the covers
ooh, and nearly has his man, the French cut skewing down perilously close to the leg stick, trying to cut one on off
now this is a big wicket - rapped low and clearly on off, McCullum trying to sweep and missing completely
confident shout from Afridi - that one through the gate and hitting him high on the thigh - even though bang on middle
played forward
worked round off the legs through the 45
good start, planting on a good length outside off and that carried through with some good pace - the batsman failing to connect, luckily for him really
stands tall and delivers one which steeples in from just outside off and defended on the back foot
tries to straight pull off the back foot, but mistimes the ball and it crashes into the ground in front of off
straight half-volley, brandished through mid-on with a lovely pick-up off the legs, and a good call to come back for the second
outside off, better length, and though Fulton thinks of driving, he checks his shot into the covers
on leg, easily played off the knee to the man at deep square; not quite where the bowler was aiming for, but he will be happy with an economical over
driven off the legs to midwicket
wide down leg
adjusted to the off-side, driven out to cover
half-hearted shout on off which told its own story
played off the legs behind square and the fielder trips in returning
cutting back in from outside off
wide outside off and a huge appeal for a run-out from one to cover where Younis did well to recover. It looked out to the naked eye, but the replays show he was quite clearly grounded
outside off, Styris lifts up off the bottom of his bat but can't clear the cover boundary - the ball goes up straight and back down into the hands of Sohail way inside the rope
a mishit, too, from Fulton - straight down the ground
two in three balls now for Gul as Fulton, standing straight, doesn't get over the ball and pops a straightforward catch to cover
greets him with a bouncer, McMillan ducking under, unbothered
beat third man this time
good delivery to round off an excellent over, beating the bat on its way through
played off the legs to midwicket
driven out tamely wide of mid-on and there's another referral - McMillan's looking a combination of worried and furious but needn't worry as the direct shy just isn't quite enough
driven out to long-off for an easy single
hello, massive, to coin a Mark Nicholasonian phrase - a huge swing straight over long-off
heaved to cow corner this time

goes to clear long-off again with the huge lift off the bottom of the bat, but - like Styris earlier - did not get the distance and Shoaib stays firm, and strong, to take the catch yards in from the rope
stays over the wicket, pushing across the left hander who plays with a straight bat off the back foot
driven out to mid-off, a dab really, and they shuffle through immediately
nipping in at the right hander, played down off the back foot and a quick single is a risky one too, as he was nearly run out at the non-striker's end. Direct hit would have had him gone
flings down a bouncer that gets up around the upper chest region, Oram swaying slightly backward, enough for the ball to travel past
round the wicket, angling in from quite wide too, a good yorker which is well dug out
round the wicket again, angling in, with some lift too, and Oram's would-be carve over mid-on takes a big snick through to Akmal
tight delivery
wristed to midwicket, then a horrible mix-up: Vettori turning down the second and then sacrificing himself - walking out of his crease to allow Taylor to get back in
outside off, worked to deep backward point
short on off, heaved to the leg-side and some very welcome runs for New Zealand
deceptive delivery, dropping at the last minute just in front of off, the batsman dealing with it well to work to short midwicket
a hint of turn again, the batsman waiting and waiting and finally prodding a defensive on the back foot
pushed right up there, straight, no room to do anything but defend
right up there again, but well worked out to long off for a single
on off, dragged a touch short, worked out well off the back foot to a wideish third man
good yorker, dug out to cover, and both batsmen set off, shuffle two or three yards, and then run back
full again - we've seen Brett Lee find success with his full deliveries this tournament  - and the batsmen can only find a single to cover
driven out to extra cover - firmly enough, but straight to the fielder
quick single for Bond
a dot this time to a yorker
would have been out but for a no-ball - caught trying to paddle over fine leg, but a top-edge - and here comes the free hit
driven off the back foot to cover
comes from wide of the crease, angling into the right hander who in turn drives out to long-on
wide of the crease, again, radaring outside leg at yorker length, where the batsman jabs down late
yet another calamitous mix-up and Bond now sacrifices himself for Taylor - a drive out to cover and they come back for the two, but there was only ever one-and-a-half on at most
full delivery dug out with a desperate, but well-struck, drive straight through long-on
Taylor steps out now and plants his front foot wide to give himself room to drive long and hard over long-on
played off the legs through midwicket, a cleanish strike into the ground, and that races away, too
wideish down off and an appeal as Taylor cuts into the ground - the noise was likely to have been bat into ground
low full toss driven wide of long-off who races and races and finally cuts it off with a lunge - good fielding

low full toss pulled high in the air off the bottomn of the bat and that's a poor piece of keeping from Akmal who calls for it... and then fluffs it. That may be amusing, but let's hope for his sake that it doesn't come down to a run...
